title: E95-1033

sentences.text: We provide a unified account of sentence-level and text-level anaphora within the framework of a dependency-based grammar model .

Criteria for anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries rephrase major concepts from GB 's binding theory , while those for text-level anaphora incorporate an adapted version of a Grosz-Sidner-style focus model .

Entity-criterion_for_anaphora_resolution.label: Criteria for anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries rephrase major concepts from GB's binding theory
aliases: Criteria for anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries rephrase major concepts from GB's binding theory
Entity-criterion_for_anaphora_resolution.description: Criteria that rephrase major concepts from Government-Binding theory to resolve anaphora within sentence boundaries

mentions.local_name: Criteria for anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries rephrase major concepts from GB's binding theory

Entity-those_for_text-level_anaphora_inc.label: those for text-level anaphora incorporate an adapted version of a Grosz-Sidner-style focus model
aliases: those for text-level anaphora incorporate an adapted version of a Grosz-Sidner-style focus model
Entity-those_for_text-level_anaphora_inc.description: A focus model that incorporates an adapted version of the Grosz-Sidner style, used for resolving text-level anaphora.

mentions.local_name: those for text-level anaphora incorporate an adapted version of a Grosz-Sidner-style focus model

Entity-a_unified_account_of_sentence-lev.label: a unified account of sentence-level and text-level anaphora within the framework of a dependency-based grammar model
aliases: a unified account of sentence-level and text-level anaphora within the framework of a dependency-based grammar model
Entity-a_unified_account_of_sentence-lev.description: A research model that provides a comprehensive explanation for resolving anaphoric references both within individual sentences (sentence-level) and across multiple sentences (text-level), using a dependency-based grammar approach.

mentions.local_name: a unified account of sentence-level and text-level anaphora within the framework of a dependency-based grammar model

Entity-anaphora_resolution_within_senten.label: anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries
Entity-anaphora_resolution_within_senten.description: The process or technique of resolving ambiguous pronoun references within the boundaries of a single sentence, using criteria that rephrase major concepts from binding theory.

Entity-major_concept_from_gb_s_binding_t.label: major concepts from GB's binding theory
aliases: major concepts from GB's binding theory
Entity-major_concept_from_gb_s_binding_t.description: Key principles and ideas from Government-Binding (GB) theory that relate to binding, specifically concepts that influence anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries.

mentions.local_name: major concepts from GB's binding theory

Entity-criterion_for_anaphora_resolution.label: Criteria for anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries
aliases: Criteria for anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries
Entity-criterion_for_anaphora_resolution.description: A set of guidelines or rules governing the resolution of pronouns referring back to previous nouns within sentence boundaries

mentions.local_name: Criteria for anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries

Entity-those_for_text-level_anaphora.label: those for text-level anaphora
Entity-those_for_text-level_anaphora.description: A method or approach used to resolve anaphoric references that span multiple sentences within a text.

Entity-text-level_anaphora.label: text-level anaphora
Entity-text-level_anaphora.description: A type of linguistic phenomenon where pronouns or other referring expressions refer back to previous mentions in a text, rather than being restricted to the same sentence.

Entity-an_adapted_version_of_a_grosz-sid.label: an adapted version of a Grosz-Sidner-style focus model
aliases: an adapted version of a Grosz-Sidner-style focus model
Entity-an_adapted_version_of_a_grosz-sid.description: A modified approach to determining discourse focus, inspired by the work of Grosz and Sidner.

mentions.local_name: an adapted version of a Grosz-Sidner-style focus model

Entity-dependency-based_grammar_model.label: dependency-based grammar model
Entity-dependency-based_grammar_model.description: A computational framework or theoretical framework that uses dependencies between words to analyze, generate, or process language.

Entity-gb_s_binding_theory.label: GB's binding theory
Entity-gb_s_binding_theory.description: A linguistic framework that proposes rules and principles governing the relationship between pronouns and their antecedents.

Entity-grosz-sidner-style_focus_model.label: Grosz-Sidner-style focus model
Entity-grosz-sidner-style_focus_model.description: A computational framework that models human attention and focuses on specific entities or concepts, inspired by the work of Barbara Grosz and Candace Sidner.

Entity-s_binding_theory.label: 's binding theory
Entity-s_binding_theory.description: A theoretical framework that explains how pronouns and other referring expressions are linked to their antecedents

Entity-gb.label: GB
Entity-gb.description: The Government of the United Kingdom

Entity-criterion.label: Criteria
Entity-criterion.description: A set of principles or guidelines used to evaluate or determine something

Entity-we.label: We
Entity-we.description: A group or organization consisting of researchers, authors, or individuals with similar roles

Entity-we_provide.label: We provide
Entity-we_provide.description: The entity providing something, often referring to authors or creators.

Entity-account.label: account
Entity-account.description: A record or summary of financial transactions, events, or activities

summary: We provide a unified account of sentence-level and text-level anaphora within the framework of a dependency-based grammar model . Criteria for anaphora resolution within sentence boundaries rephrase major concepts from GB 's binding theory , while those for text-level anaphora incorporate an adapted version of a Grosz-Sidner-style focus model .

Predicate-provide.label: provide
Predicate-provide.description: To provide means to offer or supply something (e.g. information, resources, explanation) that satisfies a need or requirement, connecting the subject with an object that represents the thing being offered.

skos:broader.label: rephrase
skos:broader.description: To rephrase means to express or convey information using alternative words, phrases, or formulations that preserve the original meaning and intent. This predicate connects the subject (e.g., criteria) with the object (e.g., major concepts from GB's binding theory), indicating a transformation of language form while maintaining its underlying content.

Predicate-incorporate.label: incorporate
Predicate-incorporate.description: To integrate or assimilate one thing into another, often resulting in a new entity that combines characteristics from both. This predicate suggests a process of unification, where distinct elements are merged to form a cohesive whole.
